title: Installing Kreuzberg 3.0.0 via poetry/pip does not install the _ocr module on windows
body:
I recently tried to install Kreuzberg via Poetry using `poetry add kreuzberg`. 
The line added to my pyproject.toml was `kreuzberg = "^3.0.0"`
The error that ensued after running my project was:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 198, in _run_module_as_main
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 88, in _run_code
  File "D:\dev\landtagszusammenfasser\collector\collector\main.py", line 10, in <module>
    from collector.config import CollectorConfiguration
  File "D:\dev\landtagszusammenfasser\collector\collector\config.py", line 6, in <module>
    from collector.scrapercache import ScraperCache
  File "D:\dev\landtagszusammenfasser\collector\collector\scrapercache.py", line 5, in <module>
    from collector.document import Document
  File "D:\dev\landtagszusammenfasser\collector\collector\document.py", line 8, in <module>
    from kreuzberg import ExtractionConfig, extract_file, TesseractConfig, PSMMode
  File "C:\Users\Benedikt\AppData\Local\pypoetry\Cache\virtualenvs\collector-nweI4fBd-py3.13\Lib\site-packages\kreuzberg\__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
    from kreuzberg._ocr._easyocr import EasyOCRConfig
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'kreuzberg._ocr'
```
And indeed, looking at the site-packages in the local environment there is no _ocr module installed even if the module clearly is in main.
The contents of the `kreuzberg` site-package are:
```
__pycache__/
__init__.py
_chunker.py
_constants.py
_mime_types.py
_playa.py
_registry.py
_types.py
exceptions.py
extraction.py
py.typed
```

I tried the same via pip in poetry's venv (pip install kreuzberg) as well as installing various extras [easyocr/paddleocr/all], but none of these options actually installed the _ocr package.

The issue is not present in 2.1, where everything works smoothly.

Is this a known issue? Did I overlook something? Help is appreciated!
author: Chrystalkey

comments.body:
thanks for reporing this. 

Very weird. I will have to take a look into this asap.

Hi, please see if version 3.0.1 resolves the issue for you. 

I verified this locally - the tar.gz file is correct. Wanna be absolutely sure though.
Yes, the module is found and the extraction is running. Thanks a lot for the quick fix!

satisfaction_conditions: A fix that resolves the missing module error
A working installation of Kreuzberg with OCR functionality on Windows
A timely resolution to the package installation issue
A solution that works with their existing package management setup (Poetry/pip)

title: TesseractNotFoundError: "tesseract is not installed or it's not in your PATH" during image extraction
body:
When attempting to extract text from an image file (e.g., `page1_img1.png`) using Kreuzberg, the following error is encountered:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/path/to/project/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pytesseract/pytesseract.py", line 275, in run_tesseract
    proc = subprocess.Popen(cmd_args, **subprocess_args())
  File "/path/to/python3.10/subprocess.py", line 971, in __init__
    self._execute_child(args, executable, preexec_fn, close_fds,
  File "/path/to/python3.10/subprocess.py", line 1863, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg, err_filename)
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'tesseract'

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/path/to/project/main.py", line 35, in <module>
    asyncio.run(main())
  File "/path/to/python3.10/asyncio/runners.py", line 44, in run
    return loop.run_until_complete(main)
  File "/path/to/python3.10/asyncio/base_events.py", line 649, in run_until_complete
    return future.result()
  File "/path/to/project/main.py", line 29, in main
    await extract_image()
  File "/path/to/project/main.py", line 14, in extract_image
    result = await extract_file("page1_img1.png")
  File "/path/to/project/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/kreuzberg/extraction.py", line 138, in extract_file
    return ExtractionResult(content=await _extract_image_with_tesseract(file_path), mime_type=PLAIN_TEXT_MIME_TYPE)
  File "/path/to/project/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/kreuzberg/_extractors.py", line 156, in _extract_image_with_tesseract
    return normalize_spaces(cast(str, image_to_string(str(file_path))))
  File "/path/to/project/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pytesseract/pytesseract.py", line 486, in image_to_string
    return {
  File "/path/to/project/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pytesseract/pytesseract.py", line 489, in <lambda>
    Output.STRING: lambda: run_and_get_output(*args),
  File "/path/to/project/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pytesseract/pytesseract.py", line 352, in run_and_get_output
    run_tesseract(**kwargs)
  File "/path/to/project/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pytesseract/pytesseract.py", line 280, in run_tesseract
    raise TesseractNotFoundError()
pytesseract.pytesseract.TesseractNotFoundError: tesseract is not installed or it's not in your PATH. See README file for more information.
```

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Install and set up Kreuzberg in a Python 3.10 environment.  
2. Attempt to extract text from an image file (e.g., `page1_img1.png`) using the `extract_file` method.  
3. Observe the traceback indicating that Tesseract is not found.

**Expected Behavior:**  
The library should either provide a clear error message with instructions on how to install Tesseract or handle the missing dependency gracefully by suggesting that the Tesseract package be downloaded and installed.

**Additional Context:**  
- **Operating System:** Linux  
- **Python Version:** 3.10  
- The error clearly indicates that Tesseract OCR is not installed or not available in the PATH. Since Tesseract is required for image text extraction, it might be beneficial to update the documentation (or error messaging) with installation instructions or suggestions to download the package if it is missing.

Any guidance on how to resolve this issue or suggestions for improving the dependency check would be appreciated.
author: Programmer-RD-AI

comments.body:
Hi. The readme has a section about dependencies. 

In a nutshell, install them 😁

satisfaction_conditions: Clear direction on where to find installation instructions for the required dependency
Brief, straightforward guidance that acknowledges the need to install the missing dependency
Confirmation that the error was due to missing dependencies rather than a code issue
